results.title: ....And everything nice
results.creator_credit: Norma Adams and Columbia Broadcasting System
results.brief_description: Through the process of consciousness raising, women develop new expectations for themselves and a sense of self-worth. The process is marked by an understanding of the ways in which society teaches women to assume passive roles in directing their own lives. In asserting themselves for the first time, many women experience fears and conflicts about the future of women as members of society.

results.title: (dis)LOCATIONs symposium
results.creator_credit: Anna Munster, Peter Weibel, Dennis Del Favero and Jeffrey Shaw
results.brief_description:
A conference about fragmentation of ‘community’, urbanisation and the collapse of locale and neighbourhood, the erosion of the private spaces of the sexual and familial. These have emerged as thematics attributable to the restructuring and divergent flows of new information economies and mediascapes.

Featuring key note speakers including Jeffrey Shaw, Dennis Del Favero, Agnes Hegedus, Susan Norrie, Peter Weibel, Ursula Frohne, Lev Manovich.

results.title: #AllMyMovies
results.creator_credit: Shia LaBeouf and Nastja Säde Rönkkö

constellations_other.name: Now watch this
constellations_other.description: In a video-saturated world, how do you keep focus? Do you keep a close eye on one thing, or step back and watch the parade of images go by, to see the whole thing?

results.description: LaBeouf, Rönkkö and Turner invited the public to join Shia LaBeouf as he watched all his movies, consecutively in reverse chronological order over the course of three days, 24 hours a day, with the performance continuously broadcast online.
description_for_label: LaBeouf, Rönkkö and Turner invited the public to join Shia LaBeouf as he watched all his movies, consecutively in reverse chronological order over the course of three days, 24 hours a day, with the performance continuously broadcast online.

results.title: !OINK
results.creator_credit: Victoria University EDIM and Ruth Fleishman
results.brief_description: An interactive adaptation of a novel by Melbourne writer Eric Dando, !OINK is an exploration through various stages of life of Squirly Fern. We travel into the details of his life as he tries to find a place for himself in a world of the post-human step family animal/human genetic engineering; alien prototype inventions; corporate ownership od sleep and awake states and technology as a spiritual saviour.

results.title: 'Where dead men lie': spotlight the director
results.creator_credit: Chris McGill, Richard Mason and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Based on the production of “Where dead men lie”, highlighting the role of the director, Keith Gow. This film shows his involvement in screen testing, location shooting, editing and mixing. Suitable for Years 7-12.

results.title: 'Servent' solves a problem
results.creator_credit: Ivor P. Kershaw and Factual Films of Australia
results.brief_description: A demonstration of how a newly-developed system of wiring between your house and the main electricity supply may be used to eliminate unsightly masses of wires between your home and the poles in the street. (Sponsored by Olympic Cables.)

results.title: 'Screen It' 2013 [finalists and winning entries]
results.brief_description: ‘Screen It’ is ACMI’s nation-wide annual competition for Primary and Secondary School students. In 2013, the theme of “connect” drew entries from every state and territory in Australia. The entries in this compilation are the winners in each category, encompassing the best in live action, animation and videogames, best overall entries and the winners of the ‘Bullying. No Way!’ prize.

results.title: 'round and 'round
results.creator_credit: Barbara Greene, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: When Alex Lawson, minister, came to Moose Jaw, Saskatchewan, he recognized the need for a family self-help program. In cooperation with his parishioners, he organized the Minto Family Life Education Program. Through group meetings, they are learning new skills to help them restructure their lives and resolve personal problems. Though the people participating in this program live in a small Prairie town, their concerns are universal, like raising children, adolescence, loneliness, marital strife and alcoholism.
